title: Subspace Diffusion Posterior Sampling for Travel-Time Tomography
abstract:
Diffusion models have been widely studied as effective generative tools for
solving inverse problems. The main ideas focus on performing the reverse
sampling process conditioned on noisy measurements, using well-established
numerical solvers for gradient updates. Although diffusion-based sampling
methods can produce high-quality reconstructions, challenges persist in
nonlinear PDE-based inverse problems and sampling speed. In this work, we
explore solving PDE-based travel-time tomography based on subspace diffusion
generative models. Our main contributions are twofold: First, we propose a
posterior sampling process for PDE-based inverse problems by solving the
associated adjoint-state equation. Second, we resorted to the subspace-based
dimension reduction technique for conditional sampling acceleration, enabling
solving the PDE-based inverse problems from coarse to refined grids. Our
numerical experiments showed satisfactory advancements in improving the
travel-time imaging quality and reducing the sampling time for reconstruction.
